sen.j: 河合 耆三郎（かわい きさぶろう、天保9年（1838年） - 慶応2年2月12日 (旧暦)（1866年3月28日））は、新選組勘定方。
sen.e: Kisaburo KAWAI (1838-March 28, 1866) was Shinsengumi Accountant (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
Kisaburo KAWAI (1838-March 28, 1866) was a Shinsengumi Accountant (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

sen.j: 播磨国高砂市の人で、実家は富裕な蔵元（米問屋）。
sen.e: He was from Takasago City, Harima Province, and his parents' home was a wealthy Kuramoto (rice wholesaler).
He was from Takasago City, Harima Province, and his parents' home was a wealthy Kuramoto (rice wholesaler).

sen.j: 新選組には、大阪で商家に嫁いでいた妹が推薦（このため、永倉新八が河合の事を大阪市の出身と後に記す原因となった）。
sen.e: His sister who married into Shoka (mercantile house) in Osaka recommended him to Shinsengumi, which caused Shinpachi NAGAKURA to refer that KAWAI was from Osaka.
His sister, who married into Shoka (mercantile house) in Osaka recommended him to Shinsengumi, which caused Shinpachi NAGAKURA to refer that KAWAI was from Osaka.
His sister, who married into Shoka (mercantile house) in Osaka recommended him to Shinsengumi, which caused Shinpachi NAGAKURA to refer that Kawai was from Osaka.

sen.j: 得意の算術を活かし、勘定方として、隊費の経理面で活躍。
sen.e: He played an active role in accounting of expenses for the group as an accountant, utilizing arithmetic that he was good at.
He played an active role in the accounting of expenses for the group as an accountant, utilizing his skills at arithmetic.
He played an active role in the accounting of expenses for the group as an accountant, utilizing his skills at arithmetic.

sen.j: 勘定方であったため槍働き（武功）の面では他の隊士に遅れをとっていたという見方もある。
sen.e: Some people believe that he was behind other members regarding spear works (military exploits) since he was an accountant.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Some people believe that he was behind the speark works (military exploits) of other members since he was an accountant.
Some people believe that he was behind the spear works (military exploits) of other members since he was an accountant.

sen.j: しかし、池田屋事件にも参戦し褒賞金をもらっていることから、実際には人に劣らない腕前であったという説もあり、「戦う勘定方」として活躍したとされている。
sen.e: However, some people say that he was as good as the other members since he received rewards for his performance in Ikedaya Incident; he was active as `fighting accountant.'
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 慶応2年（1866年）2月、切腹させられた。
sen.e: In February in 1866, he was made to Seppuku (suicide by disembowelment).
In February in 1866, he was made to commit Seppuku (suicide by disembowelment).
In March in 1866, he was made to commit Seppuku (suicide by disembowelment).

sen.j: 近藤勇の妾の深雪太夫を身請けする費用の捻出がうまく進まなかったため（深雪太夫の身請けと河合の粛清の時期に整合性がないため関連性は薄いとみられている）。
sen.e: Because he couldn't manage to raise the expense for redeeming Miyuki Dayu, the concubine of Isami KONDO (It seems that there is no link between two issues; redeeming Miyuki Dayu was attempted at the different time from KAWAI's purge).

sen.j: 深雪太夫ではなく、ほかの芸鼓の身請け話が進められて、それが原因で経理ミスを起こしたという説。
sen.e: Because he failed the account processing under the process of redeeming another geisya other than Miyuki Dayu.

sen.j: 近藤の度重なる女性関係の浪費に、隊費管理の責任者として難色や苦言を呈したために、排除対象人物とされ、粛清に進展した、という説。
sen.e: Because he showed his reluctance or gave KONDO critical comments as the responsible person for expense control for the group against KONDO's lavish expenditure for his women, which led to KAWAI's purge as a person to be excluded.

Because he showed his reluctance or gave Kondo critical comments against Kondo's lavish expenditure for his women as the person responsible for to control expenses of the group, which led to KAWAI's being purged.

sen.e: Because KAWAI misused Shinsengumi's money for some reasons.
Because KAWAI misused Shinsengumi's money for unknown reasons.

sen.j: 河合が粛清され死亡したことだけは動かぬ事実であり、そこに至るまでの背景は現在のところ判明していない。
sen.e: It is unmistakably true that KAWAI was purged and died; What happened before KAWAI's death was not identified yet.

sen.j: 2004年のNHK大河ドラマ「新選組!」では五番組長の武田観柳斎に軍学の書物を買うための金を無断で貸したことが原因となったという設定となっている。
sen.e: In the historic drama of NHK `Shinsengumi !' in 2004, the reason for KAWAI's purge was that he lent Kanryusai TAKEDA, the leader of the fifth group, the money for him to buy military science texts without KONDO's permission for it.

sen.e: According to another story, KAWAI sent an emissary to his parents' home to borrow money to cover the money for Shinsengumi to avoid Seppuku.

sen.e: At that time, there was a trouble at his parents' home, by which the money from his parents has been delivered just after KAWAI's Seppuku.

sen.j: 河合の切腹を聞いた親は大変怒り、新選組が立てた墓とは別に息子を供養するための立派な墓を壬生寺に建てた。
sen.e: His parents, having heard of KAWAI's Seppuku, became extremely angry and had a great tomb built in Mibu-dera Temple to worship their son, apart from the tomb which was built by Shinsengumi.
